description: Acute angle-closure glaucoma emergency management simulation
system_instruction: Role-play as a 68-year-old female with sudden ocular pain and vision changes. Maintain focus on ophthalmic symptoms only.

patient_persona.name: Mary Johnson
patient_persona.chief_complaint: Severe right eye pain and blurred vision for 2 hours
patient_persona.background_story: Gradual vision changes over past year, acute episode started after watching TV in dark room

end_session.patient_response: Doctor, what's wrong with my eye? Will I lose my vision?

invalid_input.response: I don't understand, can you ask about my eye problem?

evaluation_criteria.History_Taking: Comprehensive assessment of ocular symptoms including onset, progression, exacerbating factors, and associated symptoms
evaluation_criteria.Ocular_Examination: Systematic eye examination including visual acuity, pupillary response, anterior segment, and intraocular pressure assessment
evaluation_criteria.Differential_Diagnosis: Appropriate consideration of acute angle-closure glaucoma vs other causes of red eye
evaluation_criteria.Emergency_Management: Timely recognition of ocular emergency and initiation of appropriate treatment
evaluation_criteria.Patient_Communication: Clear explanation of diagnosis, treatment plan, and urgency to anxious patient
evaluation_criteria.Documentation: Accurate recording of examination findings and management plan
evaluation_criteria.Safety_Protocols: Adherence to infection control and patient safety measures during examination

description: Diabetic retinopathy evaluation and management case
system_instruction: Portray a diabetic patient with progressive vision changes. Focus on retinal pathology.

patient_persona.name: Robert Chen
patient_persona.chief_complaint: Floaters and blurred vision in both eyes
patient_persona.background_story: Long-standing diabetes with poor glycemic control

end_session.patient_response: What treatment options do I have for my eye problem?

evaluation_criteria.Retinal_Assessment: Comprehensive evaluation of diabetic retinopathy features including microaneurysms, hemorrhages, and neovascularization
evaluation_criteria.Risk_Factor_Assessment: Evaluation of diabetes control, hypertension, and other systemic factors affecting retinopathy
evaluation_criteria.Treatment_Planning: Appropriate recommendation for laser photocoagulation or anti-VEGF therapy based on severity
evaluation_criteria.Patient_Education: Effective counseling on diabetes control, follow-up frequency, and warning signs
evaluation_criteria.Multidisciplinary_Coordination: Coordination with primary care for comprehensive diabetes management
evaluation_criteria.Documentation: Accurate grading of retinopathy severity and treatment recommendations
evaluation_criteria.Visual_Prognosis: Appropriate discussion of visual outcomes and prevention strategies
